basics.name: Runze Tian
basics.label: Undergraduate Student in Statistics & Data Science
basics.summary: Undergraduate student majoring in Statistics and Data Science at Renmin University of China, with strong interests in machine learning, deep learning, and generative AI models. Experienced in mathematical modeling competitions and research projects in image recognition and generative models.

work.name: Intime AI (Virtual Reality Technology)
work.summary: Worked on 3D generation models deployment, testing and pipeline construction. Participated in building, cleaning and annotation of large-scale 3D asset datasets. Implemented multiple model API deployments and MCP service deployment. Participated in discussions and implementation of deep learning parameterized modeling for 3D asset large models.
highlights: Implemented model APIs and MCP services

education.institution: Gaoli Institute, Renmin University of China

awards.title: First Prize in Beijing Region - China Undergraduate Mathematical Contest in Modeling (CUMCM)
awards.awarder: China Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics
awards.summary: Won first prize in Beijing region for optimization of crop planting strategies based on greedy algorithms.

awards.title: Meritorious Winner (First Prize) - Mathematical Contest in Modeling (MCM/ICM)
awards.summary: Awarded Meritorious Winner (M Prize, First Prize) for research on ecological transition and organic agriculture dynamics.

languages.fluency: Proficient (can work and read technical materials in English)

references.name: Professor Peng Cai
references.reference: Research advisor at phiLab, Renmin University of China. Supervised work on edge detection and classification of monolayer graphene using deep learning methods.

references.name: Professor Jianxin Yin
references.reference: Research advisor at Mingli Innovation Lab, Renmin University of China. Supervised work on complex signal optimization and recognition using machine learning techniques.

projects.name: phiLab - Image Edge Detection and Recognition
projects.summary: Independently completed the identification and classification of edge cracks in monolayer graphene. Assisted physics professionals in processing scanning tunneling microscope images of monolayer superconducting graphene, implementing superconductor classification using 1D CNN. Participated in numerical analysis of monolayer graphene crack curves and data mining for physical patterns.
highlights: Edge crack identification and classification using deep learning
Data mining for physical pattern discovery

projects.name: Mingli Innovation Lab - Big Data Complex Signal Optimization
projects.summary: Participated in reading and discussing cutting-edge machine learning papers (contrastive learning, reinforcement learning, LLM directions). Participated in image recognition and generative model architecture construction.
highlights: Research on contrastive learning and reinforcement learning

projects.name: SIA-LAB (Tsinghua & ByteDance) - Molecular Generation with GenAI
projects.summary: Mastered fundamental principles of Diffusion Models, Score Models, Flow Models, and Bayesian Flow Networks. Reproduced multiple generative models and conducted training and testing of small-scale molecular generation models. Participated in code optimization and performance improvement of molecular generation models.
highlights: Implemented and trained molecular generation models

projects.name: CUMCM 2024 - Crop Planting Strategy Optimization
projects.summary: Based on greedy algorithms, developed optimization strategies for crop planting. Cleaned data, abstracted constraints, established objective functions for mathematical modeling. Implemented crop planting strategy search using priority queues and greedy algorithms. Completed paper writing and typesetting.
highlights: Greedy algorithm implementation with priority queues
Won First Prize in Beijing Region

projects.name: MCM/ICM 2025 - Ecological Transition and Organic Agriculture
projects.summary: Implemented farmland ecosystem dynamics model using differential equations and numerical methods. Cleaned data, established mathematical models for ecological transition effects. Completed paper writing and typesetting. Won Meritorious Winner (M Prize).
highlights: Differential equation modeling of ecosystem dynamics
